channel.title: Can i run two servers on same computer?
channel.description:
Hey I was wondering if it's possible to run two servers on the same computer at the same time?
Thanks and how would i go about it without them interfering with eatchother

item.title: Can i run two servers on same computer?
item.dc:creator: @fatwallet fatwallet
item.description:
@fatwallet wrote:

[quote=“taylor08, post:8, topic:288528”]right heres a little tut:

  1. coppy your server onto desktop
  2. open server.java and search for 43594
  3. change that to 5555
  4. portforward port 5555
  5. make another client and change the port to 5555

now you can have a world 1 client
and a world 2 client

YOU DONT NEED A NEW NO-IP BECAUSE IT STILL CONNECTS TO SAME IP!

this is a crap way to do this because it doesnt save to the same both servers!

REP LOL o.j[/quote]

Pretty much what I said, but if you have an ip-changer client, then there is no need to make a new client. And, even if you do, just go into the EGUI.java i think, and edit the port :S no need for a 2nd client creation, just a minor change!

Read full topic

item.title: Can i run two servers on same computer?
item.dc:creator: @taylor08 taylor08
item.description:
@taylor08 wrote:

right heres a little tut:

  1. coppy your server onto desktop
  2. open server.java and search for 43594
  3. change that to 5555
  4. portforward port 5555
  5. make another client and change the port to 5555

now you can have a world 1 client
and a world 2 client

YOU DONT NEED A NEW NO-IP BECAUSE IT STILL CONNECTS TO SAME IP!

this is a crap way to do this because it doesnt save to the same both servers!

REP LOL o.j

Read full topic
item.source: Can i run two servers on same computer?

item.title: Can i run two servers on same computer?
item.dc:creator: @fatwallet fatwallet
item.description:
@fatwallet wrote:

Yes, all you have to do is this:

Setup your router/network
Portfoward 43594 and 55555 to your ip, or if on shared network, 192.168.0.3 lets just say
Register (1) No-IP address like example.no-ip.info
Then download No-IP-DUC, run it, and update your server host info (does this automatically)
Run your 43594 port server, then run your 55555 port server (edit this is server.java)
Then login using the 2 different ports, that simple.

Glad to help!

Read full topic
